text: In 2017, I was looking for
a technological solution
to help manage my family farm.

I discovered that existing 
providers were not well suited

to meet the needs of the small 
European agricultural farm.

Together with my co-founders,
we developed xFarm
to fill this gap.

We support over half a million farms 
in more than 100 countries,
covering over 7 million hectares.

With AWS,
we have been able to expand rapidly,

and to store and process securely 
huge amounts of agricultural data.
Artificial intelligence on AWS

is allowing xFarm
to help farmers

to identify diseases and 
to find ways to control them.
Using predictive models,

farmers can be notified
days before the disease develops.
AI is also used to track insect populations,

so that the farmers can make 
predictions of what insects

visit their land, helping to 
protect them better.
Collaborating with AWS

we will continue to expand
our platform

to promote a more sustainable
agricultural future.
